title.narrative: F.a: Promoting collective bargaining of Dominican banana workers to make progress towards Living Wage

description.narrative: The absence of collective bargaining is a serious problem, since it leaves workers without a robust collective representation that can help to them reach decent wages. Fairtrade International has commissioned a research which shows a large gap between actu al remuneration and the living wage in the Dominican Republic. The absence of trade union representation and collective bargaining in the Dominican banana sector stands in the way of wage improvement. This project promotes collective bargaining in the bana na sector recognizing that dialogue about wage levels between workers and employers needs to be promoted as an essential step towards a living wage in the Dominican Republic. With the project the trade unions will be supported to effectively connect with w orkers and employers so that banana workers are enabled to organise themselves for the purpose of collective bargaining. The goal of the project is to improve hired labour workers’ livelihood. The project’s purpose is to improve the local trade union ’s capacity to negotiate collective agreements to obtain decent wages for the banana workers. Unionization will be increased by supporting establishment of two regional banana workers’ unions and visiting plantations to inform workers of the new union. Regional unions’ capacity will be improved by producing strategy plans, financial and administrational instructions, and training board members. Banana workers knowledge of decent work will be upgraded by organizing courses on labour legislation and pro ducing training materials on labour rights, occupational health and safety, and conflict management and resolution. Project’s beneficiaries are approximately 13.000 mostly Haitian migrant workers in the Dominican Republic banana plantations. Our partner organization is a national confederation of trade unions CASC and its agricultural workers trade union FEDELAC in the Dominican Republic.
